Description: Handle broken from mould-made pottery lamp: bust of Sarapis, on pedestal; details at rear include hair and pedestal. Below is part of the lamp to which it was attached. At rear is part of an applied handle and also an attached lump indicating that a separately applied bust of Isis stood on the shoulder of the lamp, the two busts joined with a bridging-piece of clay. Brown, micaceous clay covered with a red-brown slip. Plaster mould.
Curator's comments: Near: Weber, W., 1914. ‘Die ägyptisch-griechischen Terrakotten’. Berlin : K. Curtius, pl. 1, 10; Breccia, E., 1930. ‘Terrecotte figurate greche e Greco-Egizie del Museo di Alessandria’ I. Bergamo : Officine dell'Istituto italiano d'arti grafiche, pl. xxi, 4, 6, 7, 9 and pl. xxii, 9; Cahn-Klaiber 118, from Alexandria, applied to rectangular multinozzler; Cahn-Klaiber, E.M., 1977. ‘Die antiken Tonlampen der Archäologischen Instituts der Universität Tübingen’. Tübingen, 233; L. Benaki Collection, Athens NAM, Inv. No. MΠ 272. For two separate busts applied to a lamp of (Loeschcke Type VIII), see Hayes, J.W., 1980. ‘Ancient lamps in the Royal Ontario Museum’. Toronto : Royal Ontario Museum, 448, from the Fayum.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2005)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-present, Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
